entry.title: Lingang DRT (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that according to one traveller, the rapid transit system Lingang DRT (pictured) took an hour to travel what a car could do in 20 minutes and a bus in 40?

entry.title: Shukriyya Akhundzada (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Shukriyya Akhundzada learned of her husband's death 15 years after it occurred?

entry.title: Orange Guy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that New Zealand's election mascot Orange Guy has a pet dog named Pup?

entry.title: Appalachian Spring (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the early drafts of Appalachian Spring contained a Native American girl to act as an invisible theatrical device, but it was cut in the final production?

entry.title: Steem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Steem peanut butter contained as much caffeine per serving as two cups of coffee?

entry.title: a copyright infringement case over a coffee-table history of the Grateful Dead (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in a copyright infringement case over a coffee-table history of the Grateful Dead, the Second Circuit held that a reuser can still claim fair use despite negotiating with the rights holder?

entry.title: an Alabama radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an Alabama radio station was described by its program director as a "no-format mess"?

entry.title: this year's Louisiana wildfire season (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that officials said this year's Louisiana wildfire season includes the largest wildfire in the state's history?
